body:
Problem:
Stopping a language server and then calling `vim.lsp.start()` with the same name/root will return the old language server that's in the middle of shutting down. `vim.lsp.start()` won't return a new server until the old process has terminated.

Solution:
Introducing a client.is_stopping field that tracks the shutdown phase, preventing the client from being reused.

fixes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/33616

comment_data.body:
I added `is_stopping` because `client:is_stopped()` remains false until the Language Server actually closes—stop_client() only sends shutdown/exit and doesn’t shut down immediately. I’m pretty sure this is causing the issue.

Maybe its an idea to wrap it into the is_stopped function for clarity

```lua
function Client:is_stopped() 
   return self.rpc.is_closing() or client.is_stopping
```

comment_data.body:
Thanks for the suggestion! I see your point, but if someone provides their own `reuse_client()` callback via opts, this won’t work—`opts.reuse_client` would be called instead. I believe the cleanest approach is to stick with

```lua
if not client:is_stopped() and reuse_client(client, config) then
  ...
end
```
